Authors:
Chanokned Senwanana, Rungtiwa Phookamsak, Ratchadawan
Cheewangkoon, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Neolinocarpon heveae sp. nov. (Linocarpaceae) from
Thailand
Keywords:
1 new species, Chaetosphaeriales, Para rubber,
Sordariomycetes, taxonomy
Abstract:
A new species of Neolinocarpon, N. heveae was found on a
branch of Hevea brasiliensis in northern Thailand. The new species is
introduced in this paper, with evidence from morphology and phylogenetic
analyses. Maximum-likelihood and Bayesian inference analyses of combined
LSU and ITS sequence data clarified the phylogenetic affinity in
Neolinocarpon, with the species well separated from Linocarpon in
Linocarpaceae. This is the first record of Neolinocarpon on
Euphorbiaceae.
